intro: Cyphia dentariifolia var. psilandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyphia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to red. The plant features palmate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often hairy, providing a textured appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments within its native habitat. The narrow leaves and distinctive floral structure make it a unique and ornamental plant for botanical gardens and specialized collections.
